bio:treatment.description: Culms (3)10-70 cm. Panicles (3)5-10 cm, usually with more than 1 spikelet. Lemmas (7)8-11 mm, usually pilose or pubescent, margins bluntly angled; awns more than 0.1 mm wide at the base, straight, erect. Caryopses shorter than the paleas.
bio:treatment.discussion: Bromus hordeaceus subsp. hordeaceus grows throughout the range of the species, being most prevalent in southwestern British Columbia, the western United States, and the northeastern coast.
